original_table_html:
How Salespeople Spend Their Time
37.1% Active selling (face-to-face or phone)
21.7% Researching accounts, pursuing leads
17.1% Post-sales tasks
13.9% Meetings, administrative
10% Travel, training
summary_markdown: This data illustrates the time allocation of salespeople, revealing a breakdown of their activities. The largest portion of time, 37.1%, is dedicated to **Active selling (face-to-face or phone)**, indicating direct customer interaction as the primary focus. Following this, 21.7% of their time is spent on **Researching accounts, pursuing leads**, highlighting the importance of lead generation and prospect qualification. **Post-sales tasks** account for 17.1%, suggesting a significant investment in customer retention and support. A smaller but notable segment, 13.9%, is allocated to **Meetings, administrative** duties, reflecting the operational overhead. Finally, **Travel, training** comprises the remaining 10%, underscoring the time commitment to professional development and logistical necessities. The structure is comparative, detailing the proportional distribution of a salesperson's working hours across distinct functional areas.
